title: @media print emulation
body: There is currently, as far as I can see, no way to view the layout of printed document and the CSS styles that will be applied when printed. In Chrome you can choose to emulate @media print mode and inspect the document.

comments.body: As far as MS will switch to Chromium I don't believe this would be changed.

We need this!  I've noticed that anything display: inline-block sometimes just vanishes in print mode.  I also have issues with containers that do not span to a second print page and absolutely should.
The ability to simulate media type "print" in the Edge dev tools would be very useful!
Due to the amount of Edge specific print issues I work through weekly, this functionality is crucial. I can emulate print media in Firefox, Chrome, and Opera, but not Edge?
Yes, would be nice to see this function in Dev menu.. Now it takes ages to format output for printers.. all the time need to refres and go to File>print preview
